channel.title: Comments on: Avoid Conversions In Execution Plans By Using sp_executesql Instead of Exec
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: TOM
item.dc:creator: TOM
item.description: Thanks Denis great post!<br /> Now, I am thinking of not just reviewing my stored procedures but to review the generated code of LINQ as well.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Denis great post!
Now, I am thinking of not just reviewing my stored procedures but to review the generated code of LINQ as well.

item.title: By: Rivka Diskind
item.dc:creator: Rivka Diskind
item.description: If the column that is being filtered on or updated is being passed in as a parameter, and the column can be of any data type, I'm guessing there's no way to prevent the conversions.
item.content:encoded: If the column that is being filtered on or updated is being passed in as a parameter, and the column can be of any data type, I’m guessing there’s no way to prevent the conversions.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)

item.content:encoded: Awesome write up Denis! Something you don’t see discussed very often in that detail
